precautions: * Apply a warm compress to the lower abdomen to relieve pain and discomfort.
* Avoid using harsh soaps or feminine hygiene products in the genital area.
* Drink plenty of fluids to flush out the bacteria.
* Take over-the-counter pain relievers, such as ibuprofen or acetaminophen, to reduce pain and inflammation.
* Urinate frequently to prevent bacteria from building up in the bladder.
* Wear loose-fitting, cotton underwear to allow the area to breathe.
* Wipe from front to back after using the toilet to prevent bacteria from entering the urethra.
